description: Part first floor side extension to existing community hall building to facilitate an internal fire escape staircase between ground and first floor levels; and associated internal and external alterations
subdivision_of_building: Part first floor side extension to the rear of an existing ground flor side extension.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): 241-0-00 Rev.A (site location plan), 241-0-01 (existing front and rear elevations), 241-0-02 (existing side elevations), 241-0-03 (existing sections), 241-0-04 (existing ground floor plan), 241-0-05 (existing first floor plan), 241-0-06 (existing second floor plan), 241-0-07 Rev.A (existing roof plan), 241-0-08 Rev.D (proposed elevations front and side), 241-0-09 Rev.E (proposed elevations rear and side), 241-0-10 Rev.B (proposed sections), 241-0-12 Rev.C (proposed ground floor plan Option 04), 241-0-13 Rev.B (proposed first floor plan GA),  241-0-14 Rev.B (proposed second floor plan GA), 241-0-15 Rev.B (proposed roof plan), Planning, design and access statement dated Oct 2023 prepared by DHA Planning  & Development, Daylight and sunlight assessment prepared by Herrington Consulting dated January 2024.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
